2.text: ...You wake up on a small, old boat. A rope anchors it to a creaky, wooden dock.

3.text: It seems to be in some kind of... cave? Two lanterns glow slightly - people must have been here recently.

4.text: Behind you, the wide ocean spreads into the distance. It must be night - only the faint reflection of the moon can be seen on the waves.

6.text: You can't remember who you are, where you're from, or how you ended up in this boat...

8.text: Suddenly, footsteps can be heard - they must be approaching from within the cave...

left.text: Hide under the covers in the boat.

9a2.text: The footsteps seem to get quieter... They must have passed by.

9b2.text: The footsteps seem to get quieter... Maybe they didn't hear you?

10.text: You are still in the boat, alone.

left.text: Carefully climb off the boat onto the dock.

11a1.text: Carefully, you ease yourself onto the dock. The boards creak as you steady yourself.

11b1.text: You stay on the boat for a few more minutes to gather yourself - but nothing changes...

12.text: You slowly walk to the end of the dock, onto the rocky ground of the inner cave.

13.text: One of the lanterns is attached to the wall to your left. It seems to be made from iron, and is well-worn.

14.text: You wonder whether to take the lantern.

left.text: Rip the lantern off the wall - you'll need it.

right.text: Leave the lantern alone - you don't want to arouse suspicion.

15a1.text: You rip the lantern off the wall. It should come in handy in this place.

15a3.text: You creep deeper into the cave, lantern in hand - old wooden crates are stacked along the path.

15a4.text: You try to squeeze past the crates as they narrow your path.

15a5.text: Oh no! Your lantern knocks a crate over. Whoever is here before will surely hear you now?

15b1.text: You leave the lantern - the last thing you want is a glowing beacon bringing attention to you.

15b2.text: You creep deeper into the cave, feeling your way around - it feels like old wooden crates are stacked along the path.

15b3.text: You try to squeeze past the crates as they narrow your path.

15b4.text: Oh no! You accidentally knock a crate over. Whoever is here before will surely hear you now?

16a2.text: It's too late to hide now.

16a3.text: The mysterious figure begins to speak...

16a4.text: "Great - another thief stealing my lanterns, just what I need!"

16a5.text: It is the voice of a gruff man. Slim, short, 50s, wearing some kind of uniform adorned with badges.

16a7.text: "Why on earth would you want to steal my lanterns?!"

left.text: "I'm sorry, I don't know why I'm here or anything, I just needed something to help me out of here."

right.text: "...This is my lantern? I didn't steal anything."

16a8.text: Before you could even speak: "Actually - forget it. I don't want to hear it. Keep the thing and get out."

16b2.text: It's too late to hide now.

16b3.text: The mysterious figure begins to speak...

16b4.text: "Goodness me, are you alright? What on earth are you doing around here in the dark?"

16b5.text: It is the voice of a gruff man. Slim, short, 50s, wearing some kind of uniform adorned with badges.

16b7.text: "I thought I heard someone around here - look, take this lantern and get up into town."

16b8.text: Before you could even speak: "I insist!" The man kindly places the lantern in your hand.

16b10.text: The man points you in the direction to head, apologising for not being able to accompany you while doing his job. You leave him be.

17.text: You head further into the cave, your lantern lighting the way.

18.text: The path starts to become steeper, before levelling out again about twenty metres later.

19.text: You come across a fork in the path.

20.text: The left path seems to have an old wooden door at the end.

21.text: The right path seems to have a narrow crevice you might just be able to squeeze through.

23a1.text: You try to open the door, but it is locked.

23b1.text: You try to squeeze through the narrow crevice...

23b3.text: This small cave is full of junk - rusted cogs, broken chairs, debris litter the floor.

23b4.text: On the ground, you see an old, rusty key.

23b6.text: You leave the key on the ground and return to the fork through the crevice.

23b7.text: You pick up the key and put it in your pocket before returning to the fork through the crevice.

25.text: Using the key, you twist it...

26a1.text: ...SNAP! The key has broken in the door?! But you only twisted it gently!

26b1.text: ...SNAP! The key has broken in the door?! Well you did twist it firmly!

28.text: But, did it still manage to unlock the door..?

29.text: Yes! The door is unlocked! You open it and step through.

30.text: Within the room, you can see a huge banner, and painted on it with huge red letters you read...

32.text: Jars, bottles, cans, boxes, and crates of various sizes and shapes are stacked neatly on shelves.

33.text: This is clearly a storage room of some sort. Everything is much more organised than earlier.

34.text: You are behind some kind of counter. You climb over it and approach the other door in the room.

35.text: You open the door and step through.

36.text: The sky! You can see the sky!

37.text: Before you is a ladder that climbs 30ft high. You seem to be in some kind of well.

38.text: A rope also dangles before you from above. You cannot see where the other end is attached.

40a1.text: You begin to climb the ladder...

40a3.text: ...you fall down five rungs and hit the rocky ground! The ladder must have been too weak!

40a4.text: You get yourself up. No choice now but to use the rope.

41.text: You begin to climb the rope...

43.text: You clamber onto the grass. You are now in a grassy field.

44.text: It is still night. The moon hangs above you - it must be late.

45.text: The air feels fresh, but just as you begin to feel better, rain starts to fall.

46.text: The lantern still glows dimly, but you had best get moving and find somewhere safe to rest for the night.

47.text: To your south, the sea laps against rocky cliffs. Looking down, you can faintly see a boat - was that the boat you woke up in?

48.text: To your east, a small hut sits alone. You can see its curtains are drawn.

49.text: To your west, a rocky trail leads to dark woods.

hut1.text: You approach the hut. It appears to be made of wood, its roof thatched from branches of trees.

hut2.text: A small door, shorter than you, lies at the front. An open window sits to the right of the door.

hut4a2.text: ...and hear a loud thud from inside.

hut4a3.text: Someone or something is definitely inside.

hut4a5.text: ...to show a little old lady, smiling.

hut4a8.text: "I'm not sure where I am. I need help, and a place to stay for the night," you reply.

hut4a9.text: "Please my dear, come on in," she says.

hut4a11.text: The little lady smiles and says, "I'm glad you're here."

hut4b2.text: ...and see a little old lady, lying in a small bed.

hut4b5.text: ...You hear a voice from the bed.

woods2.text: The light in your lantern is fading - it must be running out of oil.

woods3.text: ...You can hear something rustling ahead. Someone or something is coming.

woods6a1.text: You hide in a bush, behind a tree, entinguishing and removing your lantern...

woods6b6b1.text: You stand firm, your lantern grasped tightly in your hand...

woods6b6b3.text: ...You swing your lantern at the wolf, and smash into its skull!

woods6b6b4.text: The wolf is injured... Is it frightened of you now?

woods7.text: You are now alone in the woods. All is quiet again.

woods8.text: But now, with no lantern, how will you continue..?

end1.text: Thank you for playing. Helica will continue in the next update.
